channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As government shutdown looms, how U.S. stocks performed during past closures
CFPB sues JPMorgan, Bank of America over alleged Zelle fraud
item.description: "Zelle became a gold mine for fraudsters, while often leaving victims to fend for themselves," the CFPB said.

item.title: Crypto giant Tether invests $775 million in Trump-friendly video service Rumble
item.description: Tether's move to buy a large stake in Rumble signals its ambitions to expand both its technological and political ambitions.

item.title: Merck-AstraZeneca breast cancer drug reduces risk of death by 28% in patients diagnosed early, clinical trial shows
item.description: About 87.5% of patients treated with the drug were alive after six years, compared to 83.2% who received a placebo.

item.title: Despite missing deadline, Congress avoids government shutdown by passing spending bill without Trump’s debt ceiling raise
item.description: Republicans, keen to dodge a shutdown, decided to only introduce a one-vote spending package.

item.title: As the wealthy keep spending, here’s why the middle class is in for a tough 2025
U.S. stocks close sharply higher on inflation data, but still book weekly losses
Party City to wind down operations, fire employees, CEO says
item.description: Should the company follow through with its plan to file bankruptcy, it would be the second time in less than two years that Party City has sought cour...

item.title: Warren Buffett ignores Wall Street, buys more stock in this oil-and-gas company
Banner year for fixed-income funds leaves TCW and Western Asset behind
